title: NASA wants to maintain Russia partnership but is studying “operational flexibilities”
summary: "We, as a team, are operating just like we were operating three weeks ago."

title: SpaceX delivers truckload of Starlink dishes to Ukraine, as promised
summary: The Vice Prime Minister of Ukraine reports that a substantial truckload of Starlink dishes has arrived in the besieged country, fulfilling SpaceX...

title: NASA Awards Contract for Safety and Mission Assurance Services
summary: NASA has selected KBR Wyle Services LLC of Greenbelt, Maryland, to provide safety and mission assurance services to the agency in various locations across the country.

title: NASA Promotes Howard Hu to Lead Orion Ahead of First Artemis Mission
summary: NASA has selected Howard Hu as the Orion Program manager, based at the agency’s Johnson Space Center in Houston.

title: Russia-Ukraine war raises questions for upcoming OneWeb launches
SpaceX heeds Ukraine’s Starlink SOS
summary: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said Saturday that he's sending Starlink terminals to Ukraine to help keep the embattled country connected to the outside world as Russia steps up its invasion.

title: ESA says it’s “very unlikely” ExoMars will launch this year
summary: The European Space Agency said Feb. 28 that it is “very unlikely” that its ExoMars mission will launch this September because of sanctions on Russia from its invasion of Ukraine.

title: Atlas 5 rocket rolls to launch pad with weather satellite
summary: United Launch Alliance rolled out an Atlas 5 rocket to its launch pad at Cape Canaveral on Monday, moving the launcher into position for liftoff Tuesday afternoon with a NOAA weather satellite destined to cover the Western United States and the Pacific Ocean.

title: Lockheed Martin, Northrop Grumman, York Space selected to build DoD’s internet-in-space constellation
summary: The Space Development Agency announced Feb. 28 it awarded Lockheed Martin, Northrop Grumman and York Space Systems contracts worth nearly $1.8 billion to produce 126 satellites for a global communications network in low Earth orbit.

title: ESA statement regarding cooperation with Russia following a meeting with Member States on 28 February 2022
summary: We deplore the human casualties and tragic consequences of the war in Ukraine. We are giving absolute priority to taking proper decisions, not only for the sake of our workforce involved in the programmes, but in full respect of our European values, which have always fundamentally shaped our approach to international cooperation.
